Hello all,

I am a new member, I am looking for information on a Japanese e=
dged
weapon that was gifted to me rather unexpectedly. I would like to find=

out as much information as I can about it, I suspect it may be a WWII
era =
officer's weapon or it may be older than that. The blade polish
has been co=
mpletely destroyed, and the edge has been dulled. The tsuba
is tarnished an=
d much of the silver/gold decoration is missing. What I
know about it:

The=
 blade is between 16-17 inches from end of tang to tip. It is
curved, but t=
he handle is nearly straight. The handle itself has been
re-wrapped and re-=
covered with rayskin, and two spacers have been
added between the Habaki an=
d the tsuba, and the tsuba and the handle
collar. These are not original, t=
hey look like they were taken from a
much larger weapon. There is no idicat=
ion of a hamon. The Habaki looks
original and is copper, polished on top wi=
th diagonal file marks at
the bottom and on the sides. 

The handle collar =
is copper and is marked with three symbols, two
characters and a "flower" t=
hat is composed of a central circle and
three semi-circular lobes. The hand=
le cap is horn, and is original by
my information. 

There are characters c=
hisled into the tang, I attempted to take a
rubbing but it wasn't successfu=
l. They are only one one side, but the
reverse side has two small triangula=
r notches near the top of the tang.

I realize that no one would be able to=
 tell much from the words, but
maybe someone can inform me on how to best r=
ecord and display the
needed markings/information that would allow identifi=
cation or any
other information to be determined. 

Thanks in advance.
